page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: The whole area from North to South and East to West is covered with farms of varying sizes.The land is largely cultivated grassland.In the wilder reaches,where the grass borders on Pennine moorland,and farming is carried out at the margin of possibility,sheep are reared.For the most part though,farming in the area centres on dairy cattle.Herds of Friesans are a common sight in the area.Livestock markets at nearby Skipton & Gisburn (both approx 6 miles away) are social & business venues for many local farmers. Arable farming is unknown in the area owing to the particular quality of the land and climate.In addition to dairying some farmers rear hens usually on a modest scale.
